# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution using Julia language:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ') # Split string into words
    lines = Array{String}(undef, 0) # Initialize array to hold lines

    line = "" # Initialize current line

    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, line) # Add the current line to the lines array and reset it
            line = word # Start a new line with current word
        else
            line *= " " * word # Add word to line
        end
    end

    if !isempty(line) # If there are remaining words in last line, add them
        push!(lines, line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n") # Convert array of lines into single string with newline characters
end

s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit"
println(wrap_string(s))
```
This will output:
```julia
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet
consectetur 
adipiscing elit
```
